channel.title: Windows apps on linux!
channel.description:
For unknown reasons i have decided to restart learning java and i thaught this would be one of the best places to learn again.
So i decided to give my bit to the community because ive been gone for ages hehe. Wonder who can remember me.
Note: All these downloads are fully packaged so aslong as you have the required dependances which u should have these do not require internet connection to install (usefull for old comps etc)
Cedega Transgaming 5.2.10 [code] TransGaming’s Cedega brings the thrill of blockbuster video gaming to the Linux operating system. Cedega enables Linux gamers to play Windows titles on their Linux OS of choice. Triple-A video games such as Battlefield 2, Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, World of WarCraft, Civilization IV, Madden 2006 and many more, can be played on Linux using Cedega. An easy, out-of-the-box gaming experience is at your fingertips. There’s no better way to play on Linux![/code] [url=http://www.transgaming.com/index.php?module=ContentExpress&file=index&func=display&ceid=29]More info[/url] Requires a previous version which can be found [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,67538.0.html]here[/url] link: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/15485074/cedega-engine-5.2.10__PtitGNU_.rar.html[/code]
Crossover office pro 5.0.3 [code]CrossOver Linux allows you to install many popular Windows productivity applications, plugins and games in Linux, without needing a Microsoft Operating System license. CrossOver includes an easy to use, single click interface, which makes installing a Windows application simple and fast. Once installed, your application integrate seamlessly with your Gnome or KDE environment. Just click and run your application, exactly as you would in Windows, but with the full freedom of Linux.[/code] [url=http://www.codeweavers.com/products/cxoffice/]More info[/url] link: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/15486130/install-crossover-pro-5.0.3.rar.html[/code]
Wine 0.9.30 [code]Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X and Unix.
Think of Wine as a compatibility layer for running Windows programs. Wine does not require Microsoft Windows, as it is a completely free alternative implementation of the Windows API consisting of 100% non-Microsoft code, however Wine can optionally use native Windows DLLs if they are available. Wine provides both a development toolkit for porting Windows source code to Unix as well as a program loader, allowing many unmodified Windows programs to run on x86-based Unixes, including Linux, FreeBSD, Mac OS X, and Solaris.[/code] [url=http://winehq.org/]More info and download[/url] link: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/15484046/wine-0.9.30.tar.bz2.html[/code]
WineX [code] An earlier version of Cedega Transgaming which is free and functional but not as up to date.[/code] link: [code]http://www003.portalis.it/115/[/code]
Qemu [url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WindowsXPUnderQemuHowTo]See here first[/url] [code]QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer.
When used as a machine emulator, QEMU can run OSes and programs made for one machine (e.g. an ARM board) on a different machine (e.g. your own PC). By using dynamic translation, it achieves very good performances. [/code] link: [code]http://fabrice.bellard.free.fr/qemu/qemu-0.9.0-i386.tar.gz[/code] Mini xp iso (201mb): [code]http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3565207/TinyXP_Rev05[/code]

item.title: Windows apps on linux!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

if the app supports civ 4 then it should be better but it will run all games. use google to see if the app (wine, cedega, cross over) supports it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:

Say my computer starts to lag around 1500 AD on Civ 4 using Windows. Will it be better or worse on Linux?

item.title: Windows apps on linux!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

For unknown reasons i have decided to restart learning java and i thaught this would be one of the best places to learn again.

So i decided to give my bit to the community because ive been gone for ages hehe. Wonder who can remember me.

Note: All these downloads are fully packaged so aslong as you have the required dependances which u should have these do not require internet connection to install (usefull for old comps etc)

Cedega Transgaming 5.2.10

 TransGaming’s Cedega brings the thrill of blockbuster video gaming to the Linux operating system. Cedega enables Linux gamers to play Windows titles on their Linux OS of choice. Triple-A video games such as Battlefield 2, Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, World of WarCraft, Civilization IV, Madden 2006 and many more, can be played on Linux using Cedega. An easy, out-of-the-box gaming experience is at your fingertips. There’s no better way to play on Linux!

More info
Requires a previous version which can be found here
link:

http://rapidshare.com/files/15485074/cedega-engine-5.2.10__PtitGNU_.rar.html

Crossover office pro 5.0.3

CrossOver Linux allows you to install many popular Windows productivity applications, plugins and games in Linux, without needing a Microsoft Operating System license. CrossOver includes an easy to use, single click interface, which makes installing a Windows application simple and fast. Once installed, your application integrate seamlessly with your Gnome or KDE environment. Just click and run your application, exactly as you would in Windows, but with the full freedom of Linux.

More info
link:

http://rapidshare.com/files/15486130/install-crossover-pro-5.0.3.rar.html

Wine 0.9.30

[code]Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows API on top of X and Unix.

Think of Wine as a compatibility layer for running Windows programs. Wine does not require Microsoft Windows, as it is a completely free alternative implementation of the Windows API consisting of 100% non-Microsoft code, however Wine can optionally use native Windows DLLs if they are available. Wine provides both a development toolkit for porting Windows source code to Unix as well as a program loader, allowing many unmodified Windows programs to run on x86-based Unixes, including Linux, FreeBSD, Mac OS X, and Solaris.[/code]
More info and download
link:

http://rapidshare.com/files/15484046/wine-0.9.30.tar.bz2.html

WineX

 An earlier version of Cedega Transgaming which is free and functional but not as up to date.

link:

http://www003.portalis.it/115/

Qemu
See here first

[code]QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer.

When used as a machine emulator, QEMU can run OSes and programs made for one machine (e.g. an ARM board) on a different machine (e.g. your own PC). By using dynamic translation, it achieves very good performances. [/code]
link:

http://fabrice.bellard.free.fr/qemu/qemu-0.9.0-i386.tar.gz

Mini xp iso (201mb):

http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3565207/TinyXP_Rev05

Read full topic
